sections.title: Syntax
sections.raw_content:
An explicitConstant is one of:

  (a) explicitStringConstant   % e.g.: "Hello world"
  (b) explicitIntegerConstant   % e.g.: 25
  (c) explicitRealConstant   % e.g.: 51.8
  (d) explicitTrueFalseConstant % e.g.: true
  (e) explicitCharConstant   % e.g.: 'Hi'
sections.text_content:
An explicitConstant is one of:
 (a)explicitStringConstant % e.g.: "Hello world" (b)explicitIntegerConstant % e.g.: 25 (c)explicitRealConstant % e.g.: 51.8 (d)explicitTrueFalseConstant % e.g.: true (e)explicitCharConstant % e.g.: 'Hi'
sections.mdown_content:
An _explicitConstant_ is one of:


(a) _explicitStringConstant_   _% e_._g_._:_ "_Hello world_"
(b) _explicitIntegerConstant_   % e.g.: 25
(c) _explicitRealConstant_   % e.g.: 51.8
(d) _explicitTrueFalseConstant_ % e.g.: **true**
(e) _explicitCharConstant_   % e.g.: 'Hi'

sections.title: Description
sections.raw_content: An explicitConstant gives its value directly. For example, the value of the explicit constant 25 is twenty-five.
sections.text_content: An explicitConstant gives its value directly. For example, the value of the explicit constant 25 is twenty-five.
sections.mdown_content: An _explicitConstant_ gives its value directly. For example, the value of the explicit constant 25 is twenty-five.

sections.title: Example
code:
put "Hello world"
        var diameter : real
        const pi := 3.14159
        diameter := pi * r ** 2
        var x := diameter
sections.raw_content: In the following, the explicit constants are "Hello world", 3.14159 and 2. Note that pi is a named constant rather than an explicit constant.
sections.text_content: In the following, the explicit constants are "Hello world", 3.14159 and 2. Note that pi is a named constant rather than an explicit constant.
sections.mdown_content: In the following, the explicit constants are "Hello world", 3.14159 and 2. Note that _pi_ is a _named_ constant rather than an explicit constant.

sections.title: Details
sections.raw_content: In some programming languages, explicit constants are called literals or literal values, because they literally (explicitly) give their values.
sections.text_content: In some programming languages, explicit constants are called literals or literal values, because they literally (explicitly) give their values.
sections.mdown_content: In some programming languages, _explicit constants_ are called _literals_ or _literal values_, because they literally (explicitly) give their values.

sections.text_content: explicitStringConstant, explicitIntegerConstant, explicitRealConstant, explicitTrueFalseConstant and explicitCharConstant. See also enumeratedValue.
